ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned (1) the interpretive techniques and (2) principles of Constitutional Law, and (3) the method to analyze and answer Constitutional Law issues and questions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - rigor, develops legal thinking/writing skills 
Weakness - insufficient time for the second paper
Clear expectations. Great organization: readings, lecture videos, and live sessions were well coordinated to cover the material in more than one way and angle.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely. Anyone with any interest in history or political science should take a class with Amar before graduating.
Yes. This course is very useful preparation for law school and politics study/work in general.
Yes. Professor Amar gives you so much of his time. He is an insightful mentor that is not afraid to tell you how you can improve as a scholar of American history and a long-term learner.
